feature_1.title: DCWine, the Passion
feature_1.subtitle: Wine is defined as a cultural and historical product, something that has always been present in all areas of our lives, whether through gastronomy, agriculture or simply in the most recreational events. The origin of wine is very ancient and closely linked to the development of man. Present in all civilizations. Wine is also connected to the idea of ​​celebrating; an event, a moment, a special date, an achievement, a reunion, a love. All of this is amplified when you appreciate what is inside each bottle, and knowing its history.

feature_2.title: El Prosecco
feature_2.subtitle: The hills of Prosecco di Conegliano and Valdobbiadene have been declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO (July 7, 2018) due to the exceptional universal value of the Veneto landscape, these hills represent the world of Italian prosecco: thirty kilometers of steep slopes covered with vineyards, thanks to the climate and terrain that facilitate their production. Here Prosecco DeGiusti is born, a quality product, available in three variants, “Glera” grape variety, made with an exclusive method of double pressure fermentation in barrels that take the name “Autoclavi”, unique in the world and recognized worldwide, for a unique and unparalleled experience.

feature_3.title: El Biológico
feature_3.subtitle: The word BIO from Latin means 'Life', Life that generates Life. An organic wine is one whose production is free of artificial or harmful chemicals for the vineyards or the people who work in them. To obtain a wine certified as organic, the vine and the field must be cared for for a period of more than four years. Anyone who produces organic wine deserves applause, because they are not thinking only of themselves or the present moment; He is thinking about the planet, about future generations and he is also finally thinking about us who in the glass serve an increasingly careful wine from the planet. Azienda Agricola La Fontursia has had these certifications for years since its vineyards have respected the Biological process for generations. Unique grape varieties such as “Passerina” or “Pecorino” make these Organic wines, certified by the EU, an international benchmark of know-how, in total respect for the environment.
